definitions.text: a line spoken by an actor to the audience but not intended for others on the stage
a message that departs from the main subject

examples: stood aside to let him pass
put her sewing aside when he entered

definitions.text: out of the way (especially away from one's thoughts)
not taken into account or excluded from consideration
examples: these problems apart, the country is doing well
all joking aside, I think you're crazy

definitions.text: placed or kept separate and distinct as for a purpose
examples: had a feeling of being set apart
a day set aside for relaxing

definitions.text: in reserve; not for immediate use
examples: started setting aside money to buy a car
put something by for her old age
has a nest egg tucked away for a rainy day
